overview: Munnar is a hill station in Kerala, India, known for its tea plantations, cool climate and scenic countryside. The town is split into Old Munnar (tourist information office) and the main bus‑station area, and is surrounded by rolling hills, rivers and wildlife such as Nilgiri tahr and elephants.
bestTimeToVisit: October to March (post‑monsoon) – pleasant temperatures and lower rainfall
topAttractions: Neelakurinji bloom area (if visiting during the 12‑year cycle)
travelTips: Visit between October and March for the best weather
Carry warm clothing and a rain‑coat as evenings can be cool and showers possible
Book entry to Eravikulam National Park in advance, especially during Neelakurinji bloom
Use local buses or shared taxis for affordable transport around Munnar
Stay in budget guesthouses in Old Munnar for cheaper rates
Carry sufficient INR cash; ATMs may be sparse in remote areas
